channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Florence-VL: Enhancing Vision-Language Models with Generative Vision Encoder and Depth-Breadth Fusion
item.description: We present Florence-VL, a new family of multimodal large language models (MLLMs) with enriched visual representations produced by Florence-2, a generative vision foundation model.

item.title: Training MLPs on Graphs without Supervision
item.description: We provide a comprehensive theoretical analysis, demonstrating the equivalence between SimMLP and GNNs based on mutual information and inductive bias, highlighting SimMLP's advanced structural learning capabilities.

item.title: Graph-Sequential Alignment and Uniformity: Toward Enhanced Recommendation Systems
item.description: Graph-based and sequential methods are two popular recommendation paradigms, each excelling in its domain but lacking the ability to leverage signals from the other.

item.title: YOLO-CCA: A Context-Based Approach for Traffic Sign Detection
item.description: Due to the complexity of driving environments, traffic sign detection frequently encounters a range of challenges, including low resolution, limited feature information, and small object sizes.

item.title: Monet: Mixture of Monosemantic Experts for Transformers
item.description: Understanding the internal computations of large language models (LLMs) is crucial for aligning them with human values and preventing undesirable behaviors like toxic content generation.

item.title: DiffSign: AI-Assisted Generation of Customizable Sign Language Videos With Enhanced Realism
item.description: Our goal is to make media content more accessible to the DHH community by generating sign language videos with synthetic signers that are realistic and expressive.

item.title: EmbodiedOcc: Embodied 3D Occupancy Prediction for Vision-based Online Scene Understanding
item.description: 3D occupancy prediction provides a comprehensive description of the surrounding scenes and has become an essential task for 3D perception.

item.title: VisionZip: Longer is Better but Not Necessary in Vision Language Models
item.description: To address this, we introduce VisionZip, a simple yet effective method that selects a set of informative tokens for input to the language model, reducing visual token redundancy and improving efficiency while maintaining model performance.

item.title: Unified Framework for Open-World Compositional Zero-shot Learning
item.description: Open-World Compositional Zero-Shot Learning (OW-CZSL) addresses the challenge of recognizing novel compositions of known primitives and entities.

item.title: Grounding Descriptions in Images informs Zero-Shot Visual Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we propose GRAIN, a new pretraining strategy aimed at aligning representations at both fine and coarse levels simultaneously.

item.title: p-MoD: Building Mixture-of-Depths MLLMs via Progressive Ratio Decay
item.description: In this paper, we propose to build efficient MLLMs by leveraging the Mixture-of-Depths (MoD) mechanism, where each transformer decoder layer selects essential vision tokens to process while skipping redundant ones.

item.title: Bench-CoE: a Framework for Collaboration of Experts from Benchmark
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are key technologies driving intelligent systems to handle multiple tasks.

item.title: HumanEdit: A High-Quality Human-Rewarded Dataset for Instruction-based Image Editing
item.description: HumanEdit bridges this gap by employing human annotators to construct data pairs and administrators to provide feedback.

item.title: Mask of truth: model sensitivity to unexpected regions of medical images
item.description: We show that all models trained on the PadChest dataset, irrespective of the masking strategy, are able to obtain an Area Under the Curve (AUC) above random.

item.title: Infinity: Scaling Bitwise AutoRegressive Modeling for High-Resolution Image Synthesis
item.description: We present Infinity, a Bitwise Visual AutoRegressive Modeling capable of generating high-resolution, photorealistic images following language instruction.

item.title: Learnable Similarity and Dissimilarity Guided Symmetric Non-Negative Matrix Factorization
item.description: In this paper, we construct the similarity matrix as a weighted $k$-NN graph with learnable weight that reflects the reliability of each $k$-th NN.

item.title: PANGAEA: A Global and Inclusive Benchmark for Geospatial Foundation Models
item.description: To overcome these challenges, we introduce PANGAEA, a standardized evaluation protocol that covers a diverse set of datasets, tasks, resolutions, sensor modalities, and temporalities.

item.title: ZipAR: Accelerating Autoregressive Image Generation through Spatial Locality
item.description: In this paper, we propose ZipAR, a training-free, plug-and-play parallel decoding framework for accelerating auto-regressive (AR) visual generation.

item.title: Does your model understand genes? A benchmark of gene properties for biological and text models
item.description: Our findings suggest that text-based models and protein language models generally outperform expression-based models in genomic properties and regulatory functions tasks, whereas expression-based models demonstrate superior performance in localization tasks.

item.title: LossVal: Efficient Data Valuation for Neural Networks
item.description: Assessing the importance of individual training samples is a key challenge in machine learning.

item.title: MISR: Measuring Instrumental Self-Reasoning in Frontier Models
item.description: We propose a suite of tasks to evaluate the instrumental self-reasoning ability of large language model (LLM) agents.

item.title: Divot: Diffusion Powers Video Tokenizer for Comprehension and Generation
item.description: We posit that if a video diffusion model can effectively de-noise video clips by taking the features of a video tokenizer as the condition, then the tokenizer has successfully captured robust spatial and temporal information.

item.title: SynFinTabs: A Dataset of Synthetic Financial Tables for Information and Table Extraction
item.description: To demonstrate the effectiveness of our dataset in training models to extract information from table images, we create FinTabQA, a layout large language model trained on an extractive question-answering task.

item.title: Dual-Branch Subpixel-Guided Network for Hyperspectral Image Classification
item.description: Deep learning (DL) has been widely applied into hyperspectral image (HSI) classification owing to its promising feature learning and representation capabilities.

item.title: GRAM: Generalization in Deep RL with a Robust Adaptation Module
item.description: The reliable deployment of deep reinforcement learning in real-world settings requires the ability to generalize across a variety of conditions, including both in-distribution scenarios seen during training as well as novel out-of-distribution scenarios.

item.title: Learning to Hash for Recommendation: A Survey
item.description: In this survey, we present a comprehensive review of current HashRec algorithms.

item.title: Probabilistic Gaussian Superposition for Efficient 3D Occupancy Prediction
item.description: To address this, we propose a probabilistic Gaussian superposition model which interprets each Gaussian as a probability distribution of its neighborhood being occupied and conforms to probabilistic multiplication to derive the overall geometry.

item.title: Quantifying the Limits of Segment Anything Model: Analyzing Challenges in Segmenting Tree-Like and Low-Contrast Structures
item.description: Segment Anything Model (SAM) has shown impressive performance in interactive and zero-shot segmentation across diverse domains, suggesting that they have learned a general concept of "objects" from their large-scale training.

item.title: 4D SlingBAG: spatial-temporal coupled Gaussian ball for large-scale dynamic 3D photoacoustic iterative reconstruction
item.description: However, for existing IR algorithms, multi-frame 3D reconstruction leads to extremely high memory consumption and prolonged computation time, with limited consideration of the spatial-temporal continuity between data frames.

item.title: Integrating Various Software Artifacts for Better LLM-based Bug Localization and Program Repair
item.description: The results show that while issue content is particularly effective in assisting LLMs with fault localization and program repair, different types of software artifacts complement each other.

item.title: Exact: Exploring Space-Time Perceptive Clues for Weakly Supervised Satellite Image Time Series Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Remarkably, the segmentation network trained on Exact-generated masks achieves 95% of its fully supervised performance, showing the bright promise of weakly supervised paradigm in crop mapping scenario.

item.title: BEFL: Balancing Energy Consumption in Federated Learning for Mobile Edge IoT
item.description: Existing research primarily focuses on reducing overall energy consumption, but this may inadvertently create energy consumption imbalances, leading to the premature dropout of energy-sensitive devices. To address these challenges, we propose BEFL, a joint optimization framework aimed at balancing three objectives: enhancing global model accuracy, minimizing total energy consumption, and reducing energy usage disparities among devices.

item.title: Stereo Anywhere: Robust Zero-Shot Deep Stereo Matching Even Where Either Stereo or Mono Fail
item.description: We introduce Stereo Anywhere, a novel stereo-matching framework that combines geometric constraints with robust priors from monocular depth Vision Foundation Models (VFMs).

item.title: Can Targeted Clean-Label Poisoning Attacks Generalize?
item.description: In a common clean-label setting, they are achieved by slightly perturbing a subset of training samples given access to those specific targets.

item.title: TransAdapter: Vision Transformer for Feature-Centric Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation (UDA) aims to utilize labeled data from a source domain to solve tasks in an unlabeled target domain, often hindered by significant domain gaps.

item.title: JANUS: A Difference-Oriented Analyzer For Financial Centralization Risks in Smart Contracts
item.description: Focusing on the impact of risks rather than behaviors, JANUS achieves improved accuracy compared to existing tools and can uncover centralization risks with unknown patterns.

item.title: FlashSloth: Lightning Multimodal Large Language Models via Embedded Visual Compression
item.description: Despite a big leap forward in capability, multimodal large language models (MLLMs) tend to behave like a sloth in practical use, i. e., slow response and large latency.

item.title: PDG2Seq: Periodic Dynamic Graph to Sequence Model for Traffic Flow Prediction
item.description: To address these findings, this paper proposes a Periodic Dynamic Graph to Sequence Model (PDG2Seq) for traffic flow prediction.

item.title: DEIM: DETR with Improved Matching for Fast Convergence
item.description: We introduce DEIM, an innovative and efficient training framework designed to accelerate convergence in real-time object detection with Transformer-based architectures (DETR).

item.title: LuxEmbedder: A Cross-Lingual Approach to Enhanced Luxembourgish Sentence Embeddings
item.description: Sentence embedding models play a key role in various Natural Language Processing tasks, such as in Topic Modeling, Document Clustering and Recommendation Systems.

item.title: Learning-based Sketches for Frequency Estimation in Data Streams without Ground Truth
item.description: Estimating the frequency of items on the high-volume, fast data stream has been extensively studied in many areas, such as database and network measurement.

item.title: Learning Semantic Association Rules from Internet of Things Data
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel ARM pipeline for IoT data that utilizes both dynamic sensor data and static IoT system metadata.

item.title: Fairer Analysis and Demographically Balanced Face Generation for Fairer Face Verification
item.description: Face recognition and verification are two computer vision tasks whose performances have advanced with the introduction of deep representations.

item.title: PatchDPO: Patch-level DPO for Finetuning-free Personalized Image Generation
item.description: To tackle this problem, this work proposes PatchDPO that estimates the quality of image patches within each generated image and accordingly trains the model.

item.title: Composed Image Retrieval for Training-Free Domain Conversion
item.description: This work addresses composed image retrieval in the context of domain conversion, where the content of a query image is retrieved in the domain specified by the query text.

item.title: SGSST: Scaling Gaussian Splatting StyleTransfer
item.description: Applying style transfer to a full 3D environment is a challenging task that has seen many developments since the advent of neural rendering.

item.title: Short-reach Optical Communications: A Real-world Task for Neuromorphic Hardware
item.description: Spiking neural networks (SNNs) emulated on dedicated neuromorphic accelerators promise to offer energy-efficient signal processing.

item.title: Inst-IT: Boosting Multimodal Instance Understanding via Explicit Visual Prompt Instruction Tuning
item.description: Building upon this pipeline, we proposed Inst-IT, a solution to enhance LMMs in Instance understanding via explicit visual prompt Instruction Tuning.

item.title: ASIGN: An Anatomy-aware Spatial Imputation Graphic Network for 3D Spatial Transcriptomics
item.description: Expanding ST to three-dimensional (3D) volumes is challenging due to the prohibitive costs; a 2D ST acquisition already costs over 50 times more than whole slide imaging (WSI), and a full 3D volume with 10 sections can be an order of magnitude more expensive.

item.title: BIMCaP: BIM-based AI-supported LiDAR-Camera Pose Refinement
item.description: This paper introduces BIMCaP, a novel method to integrate mobile 3D sparse LiDAR data and camera measurements with pre-existing building information models (BIMs), enhancing fast and accurate indoor mapping with affordable sensors.
